situation: E covered her eyes and cried when too many brightly colored pages were spread around during an art presentation.
action: The aide dimmed the lights and allowed E to view the pages through colored lenses, reducing the bright colors while explaining each page calmly.
effect: By using colored lenses, E could participate in the activity without feeling overwhelmed, even engaging in discussions about the artwork.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
